intro: Ternstroemia caput-medusae, commonly known as the "Medusa's Head" plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Theaceae family, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that resemble a crown, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically glossy and elliptical, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated as a rare ornamental species.
